body:
_From @dhermes on June 13, 2017 14:25_

@japonikaa Thanks for filing. This is something we've seen with shared state across threads in `httplib2`, but it appears the underlying code is using `requests`, so it seems to be different.

_From @jonparrott on June 13, 2017 16:23_

@japonikaa try installing request's security extra ` pip install requests[security]`. On older Python versions, the ssl module can't verify SNI certificates. Did you get an `InsecurePlatformWarning` at all?

_From @japonikaa on June 14, 2017 8:2_

@dhermes ,@jonparrott thanks for your advise .
but after install requests[security], i got others error below

i have confused because python2 run fine before Error: [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED],but now i decided to using  python3 and solved my problem.

just wonder what wrong with python2.

thanks all.


-----------------------

```
    method='POST', url=token_uri, headers=headers, body=body)

```

@lukesneeringer this likely isn't a grpc issue, but rather an issue with an older version of Python 2 linked against an older version of ssl with SNI. See [urllib3's docs](http://urllib3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/advanced-usage.html#ssl-warnings) on this.

Closing; it looks like indeed there is nothing for gRPC Python to do here.

Thank you both for the conversation. :-)
